title: Cat. 85.2  Woman Picking Fruit and Oviri, 1895/96
publication_title: Gauguin Paintings, Sculpture, and Graphic Works at the Art Institute of Chicago
content:
<section class="osci-tk-epub-section tombstone" id="tombstone">Woman Picking Fruit and Oviri  
1895/96  
Wood-block print in black ink on thin ivory Japanese paper tipped at top on ivory wove paper laid down on off-white wove plate paper with decorative plate marks; 105 × 90 mm (image); 144 × 111 mm (sheet)  
The Art Institute of Chicago, gift of the Print and Drawing Club, 1945.94  
Guérin 49, Kornfeld 36

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section provenance" id="provenance">Michael Berolzheimer (1866–1942), Switzerland.

Sold by Kleemann Galleries, New York, to the Art Institute of Chicago, May 11, 1945.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section exhibitions" id="exhibitions">New York, Kleemann Galleries, Paul Gauguin, May 1945, cat. 16.

</section><section class="osci-tk-epub-section references" id="references">Kleemann Galleries, Paul Gauguin, sale cat. (Kleemann Galleries, 1945), cat. 16.

Elizabeth Mongan, Eberhard W. Kornfeld, and Harold Joachim, Paul Gauguin: Catalogue Raisonné of His Prints, with assistance of Christine H. Stauffer (Galerie Kornfeld, 1988), p. 156, cat. 36.

</section><section epub:type="footnotes" id="footnotes">Kleemann Galleries, New York, to Carl O. Schniewind, June 14, 1945, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

Kleemann Galleries, New York, invoice no. 6988 addressed to the Art Institute of Chicago, May 11, 1945, curatorial object file, Department of Prints and Drawings, Art Institute of Chicago.

</section><section id="figures">Cat. 85.2 Woman Picking Fruit and Oviri, 1895/96.

</section>
